The Spring and Summer of 1984 was particularly difficult for farmers and forestry workers because of the long dry spells and the outbreaks of fire. At the end of April over 50 hectares of 3 year old Conifers were lost in a forest fire at Pontrhydyfen which threatened to engulf many of the homes. Helicopters with water buckets hung below were used to fight the fire which raged for many hours.
